other_tests.findings: Initial treatment for ascites due to non-cirrhotic portal hypertension.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The TIPS was later reduced due to hepatic encephalopathy.
Following treatment, a complete regression of ascites was noted, and diuretic treatment was discontinued. Platelet counts were quasi-normalized and remained steady after a single cycle.
Pulmonary findings were stable over a 5-year follow-up period, yet without significant radiological or spirometric improvement.
